key_title: Key to the subspecies of Chrysocephalum semipapposum

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Asteraceae
Key to the species of Chrysocephalum

leads.lead_text: Stems and leaves silky or cottony, not obviously glandular
Stems and leaves glabrescent and viscid or if cottony, with obvious stalked glands
Indumentum of silky hairs, sometimes gummed by a viscid exudate; pappus of female florets of up to 7 bristles (occasionally absent)
Indumentum of cottony hairs, not viscid; pappus of female florets absent, or of a single bristle
Stems and leaves (at least in upper part of plant) glutinous, glabrescent; conflorescences usually rather loose, commonly (1–)few-headed; pappus of female florets with 3–7 bristles
Stems and leaves glandular-pilose or -hispid, often cottony to some degree; conflorescences usually dense and many-headed; pappus of female florets absent, or of a single bristle
